alert.note: Alert for St. Clair (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 31 at 7:42PM CDT until further notice by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Missouri... Osage River at Taberville affecting St. Clair County. For the Osage River Basin...including Schell City, Taberville... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Osage River at Taberville. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 23.3 feet, The handicapped access to the Osage River launch area floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 24.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:45 PM CDT Tuesday was 25.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Thursday evening and continue rising to 24.9 feet Sunday morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 23.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 25.0 feet on 06/29/2015. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday evening at 745 PM CDT.
